AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: The guidance around required connectivity appears inconsistent: early instructions emphasize allowing ports 80 and 443 and testing HTTP, while later internal guidance states HTTP/80 is not required. This can mislead the customer into changing firewall rules unnecessarily (they explicitly planned to open HTTP).
evidence: “Ensure there is network access from the DNN server to dnnapi.com (IP: 13.91.55.249) without any outbound/proxy blocks.”
“Network: Permit outbound connections to dnnapi.com and 13.91.55.249 on ports 80 and 443…”
Customer: “We found the HTTP request to dnnapi.com to fail. But HTTPS was successful. So, we are gonna open up the HTTP port.”
Private note: “Guidance provided: do not use dnnapi.org; dnnapi.com over HTTPS is the only supported licensing endpoint; HTTP 80 is not required.”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer does not express difficulty reaching a human agent, nor ask to bypass the AI or complain about being stuck in a bot loop. While the ticket was generated via AI chat and handled by an AI manager, there is no explicit evidence of an AI wall experience.
evidence: “Ticket generated by DNN AI chat on behalf of Matthew Hart”

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: After the customer explicitly reported that an incognito/private window did not change the behavior, the scripted troubleshooting steps continued to repeat incognito/fresh-session guidance multiple times. This suggests partial failure to incorporate already-provided results and adapt next steps.
evidence: Customer: “We tried to use the licensing page in DNN while in a private/incognito browser window, but still got the same blank white screen…”
Support: “To resolve the blank screen issue… please: 1. Restart the DNN application and access the license page in a fresh/incognito browser session.”

Support: “If connectivity is established but the License Management page remains blank, please try the following: 1. Restart the DNN site and access the License page using a fresh or incognito browser session.”

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The ticket shows a very long overall resolution time and was placed On Hold for 9999 hours while awaiting account manager authorization, indicating significant delay risk. Given the customer's stated deadline (renew by Oct 14), the timeline suggests slow end-to-end handling.
evidence: “We have contacted your Account Manager to discuss the renewal terms and to authorize the extension. We will update you promptly once we receive confirmation…”
Customer: “We are looking at updating our DNN license by next Tuesday, October 14, 2025…”

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The ticket is marked closed in the CSV, but the visible conversation content centers on waiting for AM authorization and troubleshooting, with no clear final customer-confirmed resolution shown in the provided excerpt. This raises a plausible risk that the case was closed without documented confirmation of completion (uncertain due to missing end-of-ticket messages).
evidence: “Setting ticket On Hold for 9999 hours… while awaiting AM confirmation of renewal terms/new expiry.”

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The customer communicated a near-term renewal deadline and inability to access the License Management UI (blank/white screen), which can be business-critical.
